profile_en:
Carol Huang is the developer marketing manager at Stripe. She works with engineers, developer advocates, and product leads to make sure developers integrating Stripe have the best experience possible.
Previously, Carol grew developer communities at PlanetScale, Codacy, ubersmith, and MongoDB. She lives in NYC and enjoys supporting various subcultures related to folk singing and media analysis.
speaker: true

profile_en:
Representative Director of Code for Japan, a general incorporated association. The motto is "Make community more livable with technology". He is actively involved in various communities.
He is also the CEO of Georepublic Japan, President of HackCamp, a part-time Chief Innovation Officer of Kobe City, fellow of Tokyo Metropolitan Government where he promotes start-up support policies and open data utilization in local governments.

Other positions: Advisor for Regional Informatization, Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications, Open Data Evangelist, Cabinet Secretariat, etc.

profile_en:
I have varied interests.  I enjoy reading, music, travel and am a lifelong learner. I'm passionate about the role of women and technology in improving lives. I'm drawn to Healthcare as an industry where I want to impact some goodness.

As part of my current role I grow a vibrant ecosystem of developers across APAC to enable innovative solutions on the latest cloud technologies. 

My industry contributions Aare as board member of HIMSS India, leading the Women in Health IT committee, with the mission of enabling Healthcare with technology. I'm also a founding board member of Startup Village, Indiaâ€™s first telecom incubator and executive council member of Andhra Pradesh Innovation council. 

My favorite moment was speaking on an India panel at Cannes Lions festival, France. I was honored by the Chief Minister of Kerala for work with the Startup ecosystem and nominated to Sthree Shakthi award, a recognition for women who have impacted the society.

I hold a post graduate program in Management from Indian School of Business and a B.Tech in Electrical Engineering from University of Kerala. I have varied experience across Software, Wireless, IT and Manufacturing industries.

company_en: Major League Hacking, Microsoft Learn Student Ambassadors
company_ja: Major League Hacking, Microsoft Learn Student Ambassadors
profile_en: Aditya Oberai is a third-year student pursuing Computer Science and Engineering at Amity University, Noida in India. Having worked with various technologies such as .NET, Microsoft Azure, etc., he spends most of his time empowering tech communities as a Gold Microsoft Learn Student Ambassador, MLH Coach, and an #IamRemarkable facilitator. Aditya is the National Winner in the Education category at Microsoft Imagine Cup 2021 India Chapter and was the winner of the first-ever Microsoft Visual Studio Code Hackathon as well. Aditya has been awarded an Azure Heroes â€œCommunity Heroâ€ Digital Badger by Microsoft and is a member of the .NET Foundation. He formerly worked as a User Research Intern and a Community Intern at Progate.
speaker: false

profile_en: Kushlani is a technology marketing specialist. Her experience includes product marketing, content strategy, social media and branding. She currently consults with technology companies who are looking to amplify their marketing efforts.
speaker: false

profile_en:
Cherish Santoshi is an active contributor and thought leader in the DevRel ecosystem in India. He has contributed heavily in the technical community space for the last 8 years and managed various programs for brands like Google, Amazon, and HackerEarth. In his career, Cherish has managed programs for a community of 5 million developers across the globe.

Cherish is currently leading the Developer community ecosystem at SAWO Labs where he empowers developers to build efficient products with passwordless authentications.
Outside work, Cherish is an avid traveler, musician, and writer. He is a huge advocate of maximizing experiences and practicing self-awareness.
speaker_title_en: Head of Community and Developer Programs
speaker_title_ja: Head of Community and Developer Programs
speaker: false

profile_en:
Iâ€™m a Developer Advocate at Freshworks. I come from a developer background of Node.js, Android, and frontend technologies throughout my half-a-decade professional journey. JavaScript has almost become a professional-life partner of mine.
I actively participate in local developer communities in Chennai, India. I read a lot and like to write more often. I love open-source, public-learning, knowledge sharing, and all the democratic ideas in the technical market.
And Iâ€™m always happy to meet new people and greet them with a big smile. ğŸ˜€
speaker: false

profile_en: Shahbaz is a full stack developer and open source enthusiast, Developer Advocate @ Magic Labs, GDG Ranchi Organizer, Auth0 Ambassador, and Mozilla Representative. He loves teaching and sharing his learnings at conferences and meetups related to Serverless, Authentication and Authorization, Google Technologies, Security, Web Extensions, SPAs, PWAs and VR/AR/XR.
speaker: false

profile_en: Hi, Iâ€™m a Community & Events Manager at GraphCMS ğŸ‘‹
speaker: false

profile_en: Iâ€™m DevRel from Dodo Engineering in charge of event area. During 2020 I have prepared more than 120 speeches of our business and IT managers and created about 50 videos about the culture and employees of Dodo Brands. Today my focus is to build a strong system where our developers share their experience through various speeches, videos and podcasts, build a community around them and attract more talented experts around the world to join Dodo team.
speaker: false

profile_en: Anna is a software engineer working as a Developer Advocate at Amadeus. She loves to wear different hats and DevRel is the ideal world for her fulfil her expectations; software development and connecting with people at the same time. Passionate about open-source and AI.
speaker: false

profile_en: I am passionate about bridging the chasm of understanding between companies and their customers - whether consumers or developers - through data and research. My lifeâ€™s mission is to try to make the world a slightly better place by advancing fact-based knowledge, and promoting understanding and cooperation between communities. I have a long track record of more than 20 years of research innovation, advocating data science techniques and leading the setup of algorithm-based decision making processes and systems (such as recommendation systems) in large organisations before they were widely known or acceptable and even before â€˜data scienceâ€™ was a term. I have built from scratch several data teams, leading them to produce sophisticated customer and developer research that answers the â€˜whyâ€™ and not just the â€˜whatâ€™. I have repeatedly worked alongside senior management teams and offered recommendations on targeted marketing strategies based on segmentation, proving - always based on data! - the effectiveness of such strategies. As the Senior Director of Research, I am responsible for all SlashDataâ€™s research products and I head the analyst and product teams.
speaker: false

profile_en: Gerard loves helping Developers to succeed using Web and Cloud technologies. He is very excited about the future of the Web and JavaScript. Always happy Computer Science Engineer and humble Angular GDE. He loves to share his learnings by giving talks, training and writing about cool technologies. He loves running GraphQL London, GraphQL San Francisco, mentoring students and giving back to the community.
speaker: false

profile_en: Olia is a Developer Relations professional with 10 years of experience in the industry. Her true passion lies in building and supporting communities. Her mantra is to always give more than you take.
speaker: false

profile_en: Ayana Yokota is currently a Developer Advocate at JFrog. She began her career as a web developer, having a background in backend engineering gained through experience at various companies. These days, management of the developers community is her favorite activity. She is a founder and organizer of a Java Community for women in Japan, and also a board member of the Japan Java User Group. Co-author of â€œThe easiest textbook of Git and GitHubâ€.
speaker: false

profile_en: Iâ€™m a Senior Data Scientist thatâ€™s on a mission to enable more people to work with data effectively. I spent 5 years building an online learning platform specifically to help people learn existing data tools before turning my attention to improving the data tools themselves. I now am a Developer Advocate at Preset.io, the main company driving and helping grow the Apache Superset project.
speaker: false

profile_en: Sherry works as an Azure Developer Engagement Lead at Microsoft. For the past 15 years, she has worked as a web developer in 3 different countries. Apart from her everyday job, she is the Chairwoman of Hack Your Future Denmark, a co-organizer of ngCopenhagen, ForDevs Community and Women Techmakers Meetup groups, and a co-organizer of two angular conferences in Europe: ngVikings and ngSpain. She loves animals and supports various non-profit animal protection organizations and helps out whenever she can.
speaker: false

profile_en:
JJ works as a Developer Advocate representing the IBM Cloud all over the world. He mainly focuses on the IBM Kubernetes Service and OpenShift trying to make companies and users have a successful onboarding to the Cloud Native ecosystem. Heâ€™s also been known in the DevOps tooling ecosystem and generalized Linux communities. If he isnâ€™t building automation to make his work streamlined heâ€™s building the groundwork to do just that.

He lives and grew up in Austin, Texas. A father and husband, trying to learn to balance his natural nerdiness with family life. He enjoys a good strong dark ale, hoppy IPA, some team building Artemis, and epic Gloomhaven campaigning.

He has recently dove headfirst into Fedora since IBM buying Redhat, but still secretly wants FreeBSD everywhere. Heâ€™s always trying to become a better web technology developer, though normally just uses bash to get the job done.
speaker: false

profile_en: David is a family man, geek, musician, illustrator, speaker, and software developer living in North GA, USA. He runs on a high-octane mixture of caffeine and JavaScript and is entirely made of bacon.
speaker: false

profile_en: Amara is the Head of Developer Experience at Camunda. Before her step into developer relations, she was an enterprise web application developer focusing on line of business applications and assisting developers across various teams on implementing proprietary and open source solutions. Sheâ€™s passionate about UX, technical communities (both online and offline) and excited to see where advances in AI take us. In her spare time she experiments in the kitchen and plays console video games.
speaker: false

profile_en: Rin is a Technical Community Builder at Camunda. They enjoy discussing all things open source, with a particular focus on diversity in tech, improving hiring pipelines in OSS for those that are neurodivergent, and removing accessibility barriers to learning programming. Rin is also a Member of Kubernetes, a previous contributor to Spinnaker, was previously involved in the Kubernetes Contributor Experience SIG, and is a previous Storyteller on the Kubernetes Upstream Marketing Team. When not immersed in all things OSS and cloud-native, they can be found hanging out with their wife and pets, making candles, cooking, or gaming.
speaker: false

profile_en:
Wataru Yamazaki is a Product Marketing Manager of the development tool â€œenebularâ€ by Uhuru Corporation based in Tokyo, Japan.

He runs product marketing virtual team and also acts as a developer relation of the product - organizes meetups, a user community, tech contents - demos, hands-on labs, and communicates with users via social media.
speaker: false

profile_en:
My favorite author is Tolstoy and artist in general, Vincent Van Gogh.

I work more than 10 years, and yes, I had to the deal to the now mythical Beast called â€œInternet Explorer 6â€. I used tables and gifs everyone. Yes, I held the long retired â€œWebmasterâ€ title from when dinosaurs walked in the Internet. Today Iâ€™m working the Cloud, in a news media outlet in Brazil with technologies such as TypeScript, NextJS, GraphQL, AWS Amplify and the bazillion other AWS services.
speaker: false

profile_en: Prasad is passionate about Community Development & Evangelizing Tech. He is a Slack Community Leader. He has pursued Community MBA. He is a part of The Community Roundtable Network. He has been part of various developer communities from last 6 years. Currently he is playing different roles at different developer communities as a Lead, Mentor & Member for Slack, Mozilla, GirlScript & Rotaract International. He enjoys sharing his experiences in community, tech and the lessons learned. He is an energetic and informative speaker who presents at conferences, meetups, and developer communities around the world. Prasad has Bachelorâ€™s Degree in Computer Engineering. He is passionate about Evangelizing Tech, Meeting Developers and helping in solving their problems. He has been a part of global communities, startups & upskilling initiatives. His programs have helped thousands of developers around the world. He was featured on various TV, Print and Online Media. He is featured twice by TEDx. He has been honored by various awards like Young Innovator Award, Best Community Member & Best Professional Development Director award for his contribution in the field of Community & Information Technology.
speaker: false

profile_en: My name is Matt Hamilton, I am a software engineer and developer advocate based in Bristol, UK. I am currently Director of Developer relations at RippleX, focussed on the XRP Ledger, an open, permissionless, decentralised blockchain used for payments. Previously Iâ€™ve worked at IBM, a healthtech startup, and run my own web development agency. I have also been heavily involved in open source communities in the past, sitting on the board of director of the Plone Foundation and organising the international Plone Developer Conference in 2010 & 2014. Python not Javascript; Emacs not Vi. ;)
speaker: false

profile_en: Liz Moy is a Developer Evangelist at Twilio working with developers at Enterprise companies. She loves to talk to developers about what they are building, and does so frequently on Build and Deploy with Liz Moy, Twilioâ€™s first developer podcast. She is determined to hit her goodreads reading goal this year (40 books).
speaker: false

profile_en: Cory Althoff is an author, programmer, and speaker. He is best known for his book The Self-Taught Programmer, which has been published in seven languages and introduced the term â€œself-taught programmerâ€ into the common lexicon. Book Authority named The Self-Taught Programmer one of the greatest programming books of all time, and The Next Web listed it as one of the ten books that will help you become a better software engineer. Over 200K developers are part of the self-taught programmer community he created through his popular Facebook group, blog, newsletter, and Udemy course. In 2019, Cory gave the opening keynote speech at Pycon JP. Cory is currently a developer advocate at Vonage and lives in the Bay Area with his wife and daughter.
speaker: false

profile_en: Iâ€™m one of the few people youâ€™ll meet who thinks of three things when she hears the phrase â€œPR.â€ 1) Pull requests. I work on the Developer Relations team at Daily. 2) Public Relations: Before that, I used to draft press releases at Stripe. 3) Personal Records: Iâ€™ve run four marathons.
speaker: false

profile_en: Benjamin is the co-founder & CEO of [EventLoop](https://eventloop.app). Prior to its founding, he was an events organizer most known for producing [Reactathon](https://www.reactathon.com) and [Jamstack Conf](https://jamstackconf.com). He also runs the two largest React meetups in San Francisco and owns a software training business called [Real World React](http://realworldreact.com), which has trained engineering teams including Pinterest, Nerdwallet, Medidata and more. He is also a partner at the Oakland-based catering company [Lifted Plate](https://liftedplate.com). He resides in the beautiful rolling hills of San Francisco's east bay.
speaker: false

profile_en: Jaime is a Developer Advocate working on open banking APIs at Jack Henry & Associates. Prior to becoming an advocate, he led multiple software development teams throughout his career. Jaime is also a co-host of the More Than Just Code podcast. He often enjoys a nice cup of coffee and conversation on various topics.
speaker: false

profile_en: I came to Fukuoka in 2011.  I have worked as a software engineer in various small startups as well as providing consulting services to international teams in software companies.  More recently I have become a community manager at the Engineer Cafe, a hacker space provided by Fukuoka City to promote engineering in Fukuoka and the surrounding Kyushu area.
speaker: false
